metadata.title: CVE-2021-41183 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
jQuery-UI is the official jQuery user interface library. Prior to version1.13.0, accepting the value of various `*Text` options of the Datepickerwidget from untrusted sources may execute untrusted code. The issue isfixed in jQuery UI 1.13.0. The values passed to various `*Text` options arenow always treated as pure text, not HTML. A workaround is to not acceptthe value of the `*Text` options from untrusted sources.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-41183` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libjs-jquery-ui - 1.10.1+dfsg-1ubuntu0.16.04.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: jqueryui package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.10.1+dfsg-1ubuntu0.16.04.1~esm1').
